text: MIDI (; Musical Instrument Digital Interface) is a technical standard. It describes a communications protocol, digital interface, and electrical connectors. It connect a large variety of electronic musical instruments, digital devices for playing, editing, and recording music. A MIDI recording is not an audio signal. It is more like a piano roll, identifying the pitch, start and stop time and other properties of each individual note. The personal computer market stabilized at the same time,MIDI INTERFACES FOR THE IBM PC , Electronic Musician, September 1990 popularizing the MIDI format, and helped computers become a viable option for music production.Manning, Peter. Electronic and Computer Music. 1985. Oxford: Oxford University Press, 1994. Print. == Sources == == Other websites == * The MIDI Association Category:Electronic music
title: MIDI
